Anna Luzhanskaya is the founder of electronics importer Limited Liability Company Technology Company ‘Fly Bridge’ (LLC TC Fly Bridge). Thanks to an established logistics scheme, the company delivers sanctioned goods (microchips) from abroad to the Russian military-industrial complex that manufactures equipment used in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. In view of the western sanctions, the Russian Government has provided substantial support to all Russian companies involved in the microelectronics industry, which is of strategic importance for Russia’s efforts in the war. By being the founder of LLC TC Fly Bridge, Anna Luzhanskaya is responsible for its actions and therefore she is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine. Furthermore, she is significantly frustrating the provisions of Decision 2014/512/CFSP and Regulation (EU) No 833/2014.

Vyacheslav Manucharov is a Russian TV presenter, blogger and actor. He is the host of a show called ‘Empatiya Manuchi’.; Vyacheslav Manucharov continuously justifies Russia’s aggression against Ukraine and his public statements on Ukraine correspond with the rhetoric of Russia’s officials and propagandists. In 2023, the Russian Ministry of Defence awarded him the medal ‘for achievements in military-political work’ Through the show ‘Empatiya Manuchi’, he propagates narratives in line with the Kremlin’s propaganda. Manucharov was a trusted representative of President Vladimir Putin in 2018 and 2024 in Russian Federation presidential elections and he visited several times the illegally occupied regions in Ukraine to spread the Kremlin’s propaganda.; Therefore, Vyacheslav Manucharov is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Aimani Kadyrova is the President of the Kadyrov Foundation. The Kadyrov Foundation carries out re-education programmes for Ukrainian children and teenagers, subjecting them to militaristic training with the intent of alienating them from their home country and relatives. Furthermore, the Kadyrov Foundation provides financial incentives to the families of the Chechen fighters involved in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine to attract new volunteers and keep those already fighting motivated.; Since the beginning of the war of aggression, the Kadyrov Foundation has provided food and technical equipment to Russian and separatist fighters in Ukraine.; In her position, Aimani Kadyrova is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Furthermore, she is conducting transactions with the separatist groups in the Donbas region of Ukraine and she is associated with Ramzan Akhmadovitch Kadyrov.

Ivan Kusov is the Minister of Education and Science of the so-called ‘Luhansk People’s Republic’. He is involved in child abduction and actively supports the re-education of Ukrainian children with the intent of alienating them from their home country and relatives.; Therefore, Ivan Kusov is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Dmitriy Mezentsev is the State Secretary of the Union State of Russia and Belarus. In this capacity, Mezentsev is contributing to the illegal deportation and adoption of Ukrainian children. He is facilitating the unlawful deportation to Belarus and re-education of Ukrainian children. The activities pursued by Mezentsev are part of a broader strategy of the Russian Federation to illegally deport Ukrainian citizens, in which the Republic of Belarus is complicit. Since its war of aggression against Ukraine, Russia has transferred many Ukrainian civilians to Russian-occupied areas, to Russia itself and to Belarus, while often denying or impeding those civilians from having safe passage to government-held parts of Ukraine. Mezentsev is one of the senior leaders involved in the forcible deportation and abduction of Ukrainian children to Belarus. Mezentsev’s actions violate the rights of Ukrainian children and infringe Ukrainian law and administrative order.; Therefore, Dmitriy Mezentsev is implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Aleksandr Lukyanov is the First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Belarusian Republican Youth Union. In this capacity, Lukyanov is contributing to the illegal deportation and re-education of Ukrainian children. He is facilitating the unlawful re-education of Ukrainian children on the territory of Belarus. The activities pursued by Lukyanov are part of a broader strategy of the Russian Federation to illegally deport Ukrainian citizens, in which the Republic of Belarus is complicit. Maria Kiselyova is a Deputy of the Moscow City Duma. She is actively involved in the propaganda actions of the movement All-Russia People’s Front. She has publicly advocated for a campaign of the People’s Front to deliver equipment to the Russian military for use in its war of aggression against Ukraine. In the Oryol region, she presented awards to citizens who provided support for the Russian military for use in that war. In her public statements, she has consistently justified the Russian war of aggression against Ukraine and called for victory. She has also visited the occupied territories of Ukraine. As a Deputy of the Moscow City Duma, she has supported expanding social support to families of Russian soldiers involved in the war of aggression. Therefore, Maria Kiselyova is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Furthermore, she is associated with the All-Russia People’s Front.

Elena Kulikova is the General Director and founder of LLC Inkotech. LLC Inkotech is a Russian supplier of imported electronic components and printed circuit boards of various levels. The company delivers products such as semiconductor and microwave components from abroad to the largest Russian military-industrial complex enterprises that manufacture equipment used in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. By being the General Director and founder of LLC Inkotech, Elena Kulikova is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Andrey Klychkov is the Governor of Oryol Oblast. In his role as Governor, he is involved in the illegal deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia. He has personally visited camps in Russia to which Ukrainian children have been sent and has issued instructions that the children be provided with Russian citizenship. Those actions violate the rights of Ukrainian children and infringe Ukrainian law and administrative order. Therefore, Andrei Klychkov is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Lyudmila Bolataeva is the Minister of Social Development of Moscow Oblast. In her role, she has been involved in organising the deportation of children from occupied Ukrainian territories to Russia. Those actions violate the rights of Ukrainian children and infringe Ukrainian law and administrative order. Therefore, Lyudmila Bolataeva is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Elena Milskaya is a Russian public figure and businessperson, closely linked to Russian authorities. Her main activity is related to enabling the forced deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia. She is CEO or founder of several non-governmental organisations which receive governmental financing. She publicly supports President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin and Russia’s policies violating the territorial integrity of Ukraine, including through organising projects in the territory of occupied Crimea. Moreover, she is connected with Putin’s business elites, as their companies receive significant governmental financing.; Therefore, Elena Milskaya is responsible for, actively supporting or implementing actions or policies which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Alexander Voit is the General Director of Joint Stock Company ‘Ulyanovsk Instrument Design Bureau’ (JSC UKBP), a Russian leading developer and manufacturer of airborne electronic equipment for aircraft and helicopters, automatic control systems for hydropower, automotive components and medical equipment.; JSC UKBP produces BFNI-1 units for Mi-8 helicopters, and units for modernised Tu-160M strategic bombers. Both the Mi-8 helicopter and Tu-160 strategic bomber are used by the Russian army during its war of aggression against Ukraine. Furthermore, components produced by JSC UKBP are installed on aeroplanes and helicopters of the Government of the Russian Federation.; As the General Director of JSC UKBP, Alexander Voit is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Igor Altushkin is a Russian oligarch and founder of the Russian Copper Company. Igor Altushkin financially supports a Russian military unit fighting in Ukraine.; Igor Altushkin is supporting actions that undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Between 2014 and 2022, Rodion Miroshnik was a politician of the so-called ‘Luhansk People’s Republic’. Ibrahim Achmatov is the General Director of JSC Kizlyar Electromechanical Plant, a Russian military industry company. The company produces DZ-UM lock for SU-25 fighters, which are used by Russian military forces to attack Ukraine. JSC Kizlyar Electromechanical Plant fulfils Russia’s state defence orders.; As the General Director of JSC Kizlyar Electromechanical Plant, Ibrahim Achmatov is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Viktor Silivakin is the Executive Director of Open Joint Stock Company (OJSC) Barnaultransmash, a Russian military industry company manufacturing diesel engines for military vehicles and supplying the Russian Armed Forces. The company designed and produces the UTD-29 diesel engine, which is mainly used as a propulsion system for the BMP-3 infantry fighting vehicle. Those vehicles are the main infantry fighting vehicles in the Russian Army and have played a crucial role in the invasion of Ukraine. They are used on the front in every combat action. As the Executive Director, Viktor Stepanovich Silivakin oversees and controls production by OJSC Barnaultransmash.; Therefore, in his role Viktor Silivakin is supporting, materially or financially, or benefitting from the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Vladlen Shorin is the General Director of Joint Stock Company (JSC) RT-Techpriemka, a Russian military industry company. The company, under an agreement with the Russian Ministry of Defence, provides certification services for components dedicated to military industry companies. In addition, JSC RT-Techpriemka produces metal alloys (such as VNS9-Sh type) for companies that produce Mi-26, Mi-28 and Ka-52 helicopters. Mi-26, Mi-28 and Ka-52 helicopters are used by the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; As the General Director of JSC RT-Techpriemka, Vladlen Shorin is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Taymuraz Bolloyev is a Russian businessperson who is closely associated with leading Russian decision-makers. Baltica, Carlsberg’s former subsidiary in Russia, was transferred to the Federal Agency for State Property Management (Rosimushchestvo). Bolloyev was subsequently appointed as President of the seized Baltica entity without the consent of Carlsberg A/S. Bolloyev has thus been appointed to the governing bodies of an entity established in Russia, previously owned or controlled by entities established in the Union, without the consent of the Union entities which previously owned or controlled them.

Roman Trotsenko is a leading businessperson operating in Russia, with business interests in iron ore and steel, coal, infrastructure and energy companies. Vadim Vasiliev is Deputy Minister of Construction, Housing and Utilities of the Russian Federation, in charge of the Department for the Implementation of Regional Investment Programmes, the Department for Coordination of Socio-Economic Development of Regions and the Department of Social and Economic Development of Certain Territories. He is in charge of implementing the policy of the Ministry of Construction in the annexed regions of Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia and Kherson. Subsidies from the federal budget of the Russian Government are channelled through the Ministry of Construction in order to strengthen the ‘redevelopment’ of the Ukrainian regions currently under Russian control. In his position as Deputy Minister, Vadim Vasiliev is implementing policies which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Since 2021, Alexey Goreslavsky has been the Director General of the Institute for Internet Development. Despite being registered as an autonomous non-profit organisation, the Institute for Internet Development was founded with the support of the Russian presidential administration, is closely linked to the Russian Government and receives most of its funding from the Russian Government. Before his nomination as Director General of the Institute for Internet Development, Alexey Goreslavsky worked in the Russian presidential administration and was regarded as ‘the Kremlin’s curator of the Internet’.; Under Alexey Goreslavsky’s direction, the Institute for Internet Development has become an essential element of the Kremlin’s propaganda about the war in Ukraine. It is responsible for funding numerous projects which justify and glorify the war, such as pro-war movies, series and Internet projects. It also awarded a price to pro-Kremlin war correspondents, who spread propaganda about the operational situation on the battlefield. Therefore, Alexey Goreslavsky, as the Director General of the Institute for Internet Development, has been engaging in propaganda in support of the actions and policies of the Russian Government undermining Ukraine’s territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence.

Aleksandr Moroz is the General Director of the Belarusian Optical-Mechanical Association ‘BelOMO’. He was appointed by President Lukashenko. BelOMO is a state-owned enterprise that operates in the defence sector in Belarus, producing and selling optical sights for small arms, including telescopic sights and optical sights with illuminated reticles.; BelOMO operates as the management company for several other defence sector entities.; OJSC ‘Minsk Mechanical Plant named after S.I. Vavilov’ is an enterprise of the BelOMO holding that specialises in military purpose optical equipment. It assembles the PVKU-210 drive rotating contact device. The PVKU-210 is a part of a panoramic sight that is used for advanced models of modern tanks. The product is supplied to JSC Peleng, an entity subject to restrictive measures that provides military sights to Russian tank plant Uralvagonzavod.; JSC ‘Zenit-BelOMO’, Vileyka is another enterprise of the BelOMO holding that specialises in military purpose optical equipment. It manufactures military sights, including PM-10 and PM-25 mortar sights, PGO-7V3 optical sight for grenade launcher, and PSO-1M2 Sniper optical sight. Those products are widely used and compatible with military weaponry used by Russia.; JSC BelOMO LEMT EMT is also part of the BelOMO holding. It specialises in the research and development, production and modernisation of optoelectronic and laser devices for unmanned aerial vehicles, laser-optical systems for air defence systems, and integrated border security and protection systems. BelOMO LEMT EMT also produces optical sights and systems for light armament, laser rangefinders, range-finding modules based on diode lasers, and laser fire control systems, including specifically for Russian weapons. BelOMO LEMT EMT also exports to Russia, and is developing new laser weapons together with Russia.; Therefore, Aleksandr Moroz, in his capacity as the General Director of the BelOMO, is responsible for supporting actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Ivan Okhlobystin is a Russian actor, film director, screenwriter and producer and openly supports the Russian Government’s pro-war propaganda narrative by participating in state-sponsored propaganda events and by visiting and supplying goods to Russian troops and separatist forces deployed in Ukraine. For those actions, Ivan Okhlobystin was awarded a medal from the People’s Militia regiment of the so-called ‘Donetsk People’s Republic’ for participation in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine as well as an Order of Merit from the Russian-occupied Zaporozhye Oblast.; Ivan Okhlobystin actively supports the recognition of the so-called ‘Donetsk People’s Republic’ and the so-called ‘Luhansk People’s Republic’ and has publicly denounced Ukrainian statehood and sovereignty. He thus supports actions which undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Mark Blatt is the CEO of the Israeli company Texel F.C.G. Technology Limited, which supplies the Russian companies LLC UNITEK and LLC LINKOS with a wide range of components, with the aim of incorporating them in Russian military equipment, such as the multifunctional optical-electronic reconnaissance complex IRONY (a laser rangefinder with a thermal imaging sensor, an optical additional back-up channel and a GPS module) which is known to be used by the Russian military forces. Texel F.C.G. Technology serves as an intermediary to transfer European goods to Russian companies LINKOS and UNITEK. In his position, Mark Blatt is significantly frustrating the provisions against the circumvention of the provisions of Decision 2014/512/CFSP and Regulation (EU) No 833/2014.

Igor Tonkovidov is the CEO and General Director of PAO Sovcomflot. Sovcomflot is Russia’s largest shipping company, specialising in the transportation of liquefied gas, crude oil and petroleum products, as well as the servicing of offshore upstream energy production. Sovcomflot focuses its activities on domestic cargos and specialises in the tanker market segments that are particularly necessary for Russian foreign trade. Sovcomflot is a global leader in Aframax tankers (80 000 -120 000  tonnes in deadweight tonnage) and product tankers. Since the start of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, Sovcomflot has been operating as one of the key companies managing and operating the maritime transport of Russian oil. Sovcomflot is a Russian state shipping company, and therefore the Russian Federation is the ultimate beneficiary of its services. Such services provide a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation, accounting for more than 70 % of Russia’s energy revenue, thereby enabling the Kremlin to finance its war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Igor Tonkovidov is supporting, materially and financially, the Government of the Russian Federation. Moreover, he is involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.

Vladimir Avetisyan is the General Director and founder of LLC RBA-Management. LLC RBA-Management is a Russian management company that provides legal, accounting, corporate security and other management services, and which works with customers specialising in the supply of electronic components. LLC RBA-Management manages JSC Compel, which participates in import schemes for electronic components and supplies strategically important microelectronics components to Russian industry, including military industry. By being the General Director and founder of LLC RBA-Management, Vladimir Avetisyan is responsible for its actions and therefore he is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Mikhail Kontserev is the General Director of Public Joint Stock Company (PJSC) TransContainer. PJSC TransContainer is a Russian transportation company and Russia’s largest railway container operator. PJSC TransContainer revenues increased throughout 2023 and it recorded an increase in transit traffic in the second half of 2023, which was primarily due to the flow of Belarusian cargo through the ports of the north-west of Russia. PJSC TransContainer has also agreed to offer its services at the new terminal of the Alabuga Special Economic Zone (SEZ). The Alabuga SEZ has been cooperating with the Ministry of Defence and Logistics of the Iranian Armed Forces to locate the production site of Shahed loitering munitions (the name of the Russian version is ‘Geran’). In addition, PJSC TransContainer participates in illegal weapon trade schemes with the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) in support of the Russian Government. In 2023, shipment containers owned by PJSC TransContainer were spotted en route to Rajin port, DPRK. Containers from PJSC TransContainer were also spotted at Tikhoretsk Ammo Depot, which provides supplies of various types of ammunition to the Russian armed forces. Tikhoretsk Ammo Depot, a strategic storage facility located around 400 kilometres from the border with Ukraine, supports operational munitions storage facilities for the Russian armed forces closer to the Ukraine front.; Therefore, Mikhail Kontserev, in his capacity as the General Director of PJSC TransContainer, is supporting materially the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Dimitry Beloglazov is the owner of LLC Titul (based in Russia) which established a subsidiary, Joint Stock Company (JSC) Iliadis (based in Russia), to acquire Oleg Deripaska’s share in the International LLC Rasperia Trading Limited (‘Rasperia’, based in Russia). Rasperia owns 28,5  million shares in the European company STRABAG SE. Those shares were frozen because Rasperia was controlled by Oleg Vladimirovich Deripaska, an individual subject to Union restrictive measures.; Oleg Deripaska coordinated a complex evasion scheme with Dimitry Beloglazov to sell the frozen shares of STRABAG. To that end, Beloglazov’s company LLC Titul established a subsidiary, JSC Iliadis, which acquired Deripaska’s share of Rasperia, and thereby also the frozen STRABAG shares. Deripaska received an equivalent economic benefit for the sale of Rasperia. Dimitry Beloglazov and the involved companies LLC Titul, JSC Iliadis and Rasperia used this scheme to sell, outside the Union, a non-Union company controlled by a listed person and owning frozen shares of a Union company with the sole purpose to lift the freezing of those shares in the Union, thereby circumventing Union restrictive measures.; Therefore, Dimitry Beloglazov is facilitating infringements of the prohibition against circumvention of Regulation (EU) No 269/2014.

Andrey Kalyuzhny is the acting Chairman of the Board of State Corporation ‘Donbass Development Corporation’, which is an entity founded by the so-called ‘Donetsk People’s Republic’ to ensure the economic development of the Ukrainian region occupied by Russia. The corporation is also facilitating international investment into the region and is responsible for implementing projects related to building infrastructure in the occupied region, with the goal of further integration of the region into Russia. As the acting Chairman of the Board of State Corporation ‘Donbass Development Corporation’, Andrey Kalyuzhny is therefore responsible for, supporting or implementing actions or policies which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Vyacheslav Petushenko is the Chairman of the Board of State Company ‘Avtodor’, which is the Russian state infrastructure and highway service company. ‘Avtodor’ has signed an agreement to provide the right to free travel on toll roads for vehicles transporting aid to the zone of Russia’s illegal war of aggression against Ukraine. In addition, ‘Avtodor’ is actively involved in reconstructing many roads in Ukrainian territories which have been occupied by Russia. President Putin has taken note of the work of ‘Avtodor’ specialists, who are involved in the restoration of infrastructure in occupied areas. The aim of such actions is to integrate the occupied territories into Russia by building infrastructural objects. As the Chairman of the Board of State Company ‘Avtodor’, Vyacheslav Petushenko is implementing actions or policies which undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Pavel Tochilin is the General Director of JSC SPE ‘Aerosila’. JSC SPE ‘Aerosila’ is a Russian developer and manufacturer of various aircraft parts, such as engines, propellers and fans. JSC SPE ‘Aerosila’ provides its products to domestic aviation manufacturers. The company’s products are used to create military aircraft that Russian Aerospace Forces use in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. For example, unmanned aerial vehicle Orion’s power unit APD-115T is equipped with an AV-115 propeller manufactured by JSC SPE ‘Aerosila’. In addition, the Russian Federation has a special right (‘golden share’) of participation in the control of JSC SPE ‘Aerosila’, which would allow the Russian Federation a decisive voting right over the other shareholders when adopting major decisions.; As the General Director of JSC SPE ‘Aerosila’, Pavel Tochilin is responsible for the company’s actions and therefore he supports and benefits financially from the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the illegal annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Andrey Kocherga is the General Director of PJSC ‘Stavropol Radio Plant Signal’. PJSC ‘Stavropol Radio Plant Signal’ is one of the main manufacturers of radio-electronic devices for the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. It belongs to the Rostec State Corporation. The Armed Forces of the Russian Federation use devices produced by PJSC ‘Stavropol Radio Plant Signal’, such as remote-control platforms for PKT tank machine guns, in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. PJSC ‘Stavropol Radio Plant Signal’ upgraded the machine gun remote-control platform for the control of a 7,62  mm tank machine gun, designed in 2023, upon direct request from the Russian military.; As the General Director of PJSC ‘Stavropol Radio Plant Signal’, Andrey Kocherga is responsible for the company’s actions and therefore supports actions which undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Vladislav Kostin is the General Director of JSC VNIIR-Progress. JSC VNIIR-Progress is a Russian research and development institute that specialises in the production of advanced electronic warfare (EW) systems, focusing on technologies for signal-jamming and intelligence-gathering. One of its key products is the Kometa antenna, which is designed to disrupt communications by interfering with radio, satellite and radar frequencies. The Kometa-M variant, a type of Kometa antenna, used in devices like the Orlan-10 unmanned aerial vehicle and guided bomb kits, employs adaptive antenna arrays to enhance resistance against electronic interference, ensuring accurate targeting even under adversarial EW measures. Weapons that incorporate Kometa antennas manufactured by JSC VNIIR-Progress are extensively used in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, therefore JSC VNIIR-Progress is supporting actions which undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.; In August 2023, Vladislav Kostin received an award from the organisers of the ‘Army’ forum for his contribution to strengthening the external forces of Russia.; Therefore, Vladislav Kostin, in his capacity as the General Director of JSC VNIIR-Progress, is supporting actions which undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Artyom Zdunov is the Head of the Republic of Mordovia (a Russian federal subject) since at least 18 November 2020. In this position, Artyom Zdunov has played a leadership role in implementing the Russian Government’s policy of illegally removing Ukrainian children from regions of Ukraine that are under temporary Russian control, in particular by organising the movement of children from occupied Ukrainian regions, in particular from the Kherson region and the Kalanchak Raion to the Republic of Mordovia.; Artyom Zdunov also supports the activities of ‘Movement of the First’ in occupied territories, an entity listed by the Union and involved in various programmes aimed at re-educating Ukrainian children, including those deported to Russia illegally.; Artyom Zdunov has also been personally supervising the support provided by the Republic of Mordova region to the occupying representatives and forces in the Kherson region, including through delivery of military equipment.; Therefore, Artyom Zdunov is responsible for supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. He is also associated with ‘Movement of the First’.

Nikolai Kolesov is General Director of Russian Helicopters JSC. As the primary producer of military helicopters, Russian Helicopters JSC is a key company within the Russian military–industrial complex. Various types of helicopters and other defence hardware and equipment of Russian Helicopters JSC are in use by the Russian Armed Forces in their war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Nikolai Kolesov is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. He is also associated with Russian Helicopters JSC.

Alexander Balashov is the General Director of JSC Plastmass Plant. JSC Plastmass Plant is a Russian entity and part of Rostec State Corporation, producing artillery ammunition for the Russian Armed Forces, in particular for howitzers, which are widely used by the Russian military in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Alexander Balashov is supporting materially actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Kim Yong Bok is the Deputy Chief of the General Staff of the Korean People’s Army (KPA). According to Ukrainian and Republic of Korea authorities, he has recently been deployed to Russia alongside troops of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) in support of Russia’s war of aggression, and is in charge of overseeing the deployment of DPRK troops in Russia. Kim is a three-star general, who has significant experience leading DPRK special forces also known as the 11th Corps. He appeared at at least seven events with DPRK leader Kim Jong Un in 2024, indicating his prominent role in the DPRK military.; Kim Yong Bok is therefore implementing and supporting actions undermining and threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

No Kwang Chol is Minister of Defence of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK). In his position, he is directly involved in the military cooperation between DPRK and the Russian Federation, including the deployment of DPRK soldiers to the Russian Federation in support of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. Therefore, No Kwang Chol is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Niels Troost is a Dutch businessperson and the sole shareholder of EZI-DIAROC. EZI-DIAROC is the sole shareholder of Paramount Energy and Commodities SA (PECSA). PECSA controls the Dubai-based subsidiary Paramount Energy and Commodities DMCC (Paramount DMCC).; In June 2022, Paramount DMCC took over and continued without interruption PECSA’s oil business vis-à-vis Russia, underlining close and direct operational and strategic control of PECSA over its subsidiary, Paramount DMCC. Paramount DMCC repeatedly traded Russian crude oil above the oil price cap after its introduction. Moreover, Niels Troost is affiliated with Livna Shipping Ltd, which has been trading crude oil above the oil price cap after its introduction.; Through his ownership of Paramount DMCC, the control structure of Paramount DMCC and his affiliation with Livna Shipping Ltd, Niels Troost thus facilitated infringements of the prohibition against circumvention of the provisions of Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 and Decision 2014/512/CFSP.
column9: Trader in Commodities (oil, grain)DOB: 27.11.1969Nationality: DutchGender: male◄

column4: Larisa Dolina is a Russian singer and actress. Since the beginning of the Russian war of aggression against Ukraine, Dolina has frequently supported Russia’s actions which threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. To that end, Dolina has worked with the Russian Ministry of Defence and led entertainment campaigns on behalf of the Russian Government to reward Russian military personnel for their participation in the Russian war of aggression against Ukraine. She moreover gave public concerts in the Russian occupied Donbass region in coordination with the Russian Government.; She thus supports Russian actions which threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine and supports the Russian Government in respect to the war of aggression against Ukraine.

Li Xiaocui (‘Sophia Li’) is a Chinese businessperson. She controls and represents enterprises from the People’s Republic of China and Hong Kong which have been designated by the European Union for having infringed prohibitions against circumvention of the Union’s restrictive measures regime imposed on the Russian Federation, namely ARCLM International Trading Co. Ltd and Shijiazhuang Hanqiang Technology Co. Those infringements included the export of listed goods to Unimatik, a major actor in the Russian Military-Industrial Complex. Li Xiaocui thus facilitated infringements of the prohibition against circumvention of the Union’s restrictive measures regime imposed on the Russian Federation and thus additionally significantly frustrated existing Union restrictive measures provisions.

Artem Yamshchikov is the owner and General Director of OOO TSK Vektor, a company within the Russian military-industrial complex. OOO TSK Vektor has acted as an intermediary between IEMZ Kupol, a subsidiary of Russian state-owned arms company Almaz-Antey, and Chinese suppliers manufacturing long-range attack drones of the type Garpiya-3 (G3), which are developed and produced for use in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. In particular, OOO TSK Vektor has received components from Redlepus TSK Vektor Industrial (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd and Juhang Aviation Technology Shenzhen Co. Limited, including parts from Xiamen Limbach, a Chinese entity producing L550 drone engines.; Therefore, Artem Yamshchikov is a natural person supporting materially actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Nikolay Tkachenko is a the general manager of Gazstroyprom JSC. Gazstroyprom JSC is a leading company in the Russian energy sector, which carries out different projects for the extraction, processing and transportation of natural gas. The company employs 95 000  people and is active in all federal districts of the Russian Federation. The energy sector, especially oil, provides substantial revenues to the Government of the Russian Federation.Therefore, Nikolay Tkachenko is associated with a company involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the illegal annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Ivan Kozhevnikov is the General Director of Gazprom LNG Technologies LLC, a leading company in the Russian energy sector. Among the company’s activities are liquefaction and enrichment of natural gas, as well as construction of cryogenic filling stations. The energy sector, especially oil, provides substantial revenues to the Government of the Russian Federation. Therefore, Ivan Kozhevnikov is associated with an entity which is involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the illegal annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Aleksey Kakhidze is the Chairman of the Board of Directors of Gazprom LNG Technologies LLC, a leading company in the Russian energy sector. Among the company’s activities are liquefaction and enrichment of natural gas, as well as construction of cryogenic filling stations. The energy sector, especially oil, provides substantial revenues to the Government of the Russian Federation. Therefore, Aleksey Kakhidze is associated with an entity which is involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the illegal annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Yuriy Shamalov is the General Director of Gazprom Flot LLC, a leading company in the Russian energy sector. Among the company’s activities are drilling services related to the production of oil and gas, as well as transportation and regasification of liquefied natural gas, construction and operation of floating drilling rigs and specialised vessels. The energy sector, especially oil, provides substantial revenues to the Government of the Russian Federation. Therefore, Yuriy Shamalov is associated with an entity which is involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the illegal annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Mikhail Podvyaznikov is the General Director of JSC ‘North Western Regional Center of Almaz Antey Concern Obukhovsky Plant’.; JSC ‘North Western Regional Center of Almaz Antey Concern Obukhovsky Plant’ is one of the largest enterprises in the Russian defence industry and produces weapons systems and military equipment. It provides communications, air defence systems and missiles used by the Russian Armed Forces in the war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, in his role as General Director of JSC ‘North Western Regional Center of Almaz Antey Concern Obukhovsky Plant’, Mikhail Podvyaznikov is supporting materially actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Oleg Ryazantsev, former Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation, is acting as Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Russian JSC ‘NPO Vysokotochnye Kompleksy’ (High Precision Systems) since November 2022.; High Precision Systems is a Russian developer and manufacturer of weapons. It is a leader in the production of tactical ballistic missile systems in Russia. High Precision Systems is a subsidiary of Rostec State Corporation. Weapons produced by High Precisions Systems are used in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; As CEO of High Precision Systems, Oleg Ryazantsev is supporting materially actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Evgenii Dronov is the General Director of JSC Tula Machine Building Plant (a.k.a. Tulamashzavod). JSC Tula Machine Building Plant is a Russian defence manufacturer with a specialisation in the production of advanced military equipment, particularly in the domain of anti-aircraft weaponry and artillery systems. The company is responsible for the development and manufacturing of several key defence systems, including the KASHTAN anti-aircraft missile and artillery system, the PALMA anti-aircraft artillery system, and a range of 30 mm automatic cannons and machine guns such as the Gryazev-Shipunov GSh-6-30 and the 2A72. Those systems are integrated into various military platforms, including infantry fighting vehicles such as the BMP-3 and BTR-80A, and are also mounted on strategic assets such as the Kuznetsov class aircraft carrier.; The company’s products have been actively deployed in various military operations, including Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, where several systems such as the BMP-3 infantry fighting vehicles and Pantsir-S1 surface-to-air missile systems were reported to have been destroyed.; Evgenii Dronov is therefore supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Yan Novikov is General Director of JSC Almaz-Antey air and space defence corporation (“Almaz-Antey”). Almaz-Antey is a key company within the Russian military-industrial complex. Companies within the Almaz-Antey holding structure produce various types of defence hardware and equipment in use by the Russian Armed Forces in their war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Yan Novikov is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. He is also associated with JSC Almaz-Antey air and space defence corporation.

Igor Zyuzin is a Russian businessperson, with business interests in the iron ore and steel, coal and energy sectors. Igor Zyuzin is a major shareholder and Chairman of the Board of Directors of Mechel PAO, a major Russian mining and metals company engaging in up-stream and down-stream activities within the Russian mining, metals and energy sectors. In particular, Mechel PAO is one of the leading Russian coal export companies. Those economic sectors provide a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.; Therefore, Igor Zyuzin is a Russian businessperson involved in economic sectors providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.

Dmitry Lelikov is Deputy General Director of Rostec and a member of Rostec’s Management Board. Rostec is a key company within the Russian military-industrial complex and produces various types of defence hardware and equipment in use by the Russian Armed Forces in their war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Dmitry Lelikov is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Ivan Antsev is the Executive Director of JSC NPP Radar MMS, which produces unmanned aerial systems in Russia. Some of those systems include non-military drones, also made available to Russian armed forces for use in the context of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. JSC NPP Radar MMS works under Russian government contracts and cooperates with the military-defence industry. As the Executive Director of JSC NPP Radar MMS, Ivan Antsev has ultimate executive control over that work.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, Ivan Antsev is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Andrii Derkach is a former Ukrainian politician, and is a Senator of the Federation Council since 12 September 2024 and a member of that Council’s Committee on Defence and Security since 23 October 2024. Since becoming a Senator, he has supported policies contributing to Russia’s illegal annexation of Crimea and Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. During his time as a member of Ukraine’s parliament before 2022, he actively supported the Russian Government by collaborating with the Main Intelligence Directorate of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation (GRU). Andrii Derkach received funds from the GRU to create private security companies that Russia planned to use to invade Ukraine.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, Andrii Derkach is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Vasily Brovko is the Director for strategic research and communication at Rostec, the leading Russian state-controlled defence and industrial manufacturing corporation. He is also referred to as Director for Special Projects, effectively making him responsible for the company’s IT and public relations work, including the public relations for Rostec chairman Sergei Chemenzov.; Rostec is a key company within the Russian military-industrial complex, which produces various types of defence hardware and equipment in use by the Russian Armed Forces in their war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Vasily Brovko is supporting actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Igor Kudryashkin is a Russian businessperson with extensive business interests in the Russian mining and metals sectors. In particular, Kudryashkin is a shareholder and Commercial Director of Ural Mining and Metallurgical Company, a major Russian company engaged in the Russian mining and metals sectors. Those economic sectors provide a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.; Therefore, Igor Kudryashkin is a Russian businessperson involved in economic sectors providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.

Eduard Chukhlebov is a Russian businessperson with extensive business interests in the Russian mining and metals sectors. In particular, Chukhlebov is co-owner of Ural Mining and Metallurgical Company, a major Russian company engaged in the Russian mining and metals sectors. Those economic sectors provide a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.; Therefore, Eduard Chukhlebov is a Russian businessperson involved in economic sectors providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.

Yury Nimchenko has been a Senator of the Federation Council from the illegally annexed “Republic of Crimea” since 12 September 2024 and is a Member of the Federation Council’s Committee on Defence and Security. He is a veteran of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, having fought as a tank driver, for which he was awarded the title of “Hero of Russia” by the President of the Russian Federation.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, he is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Sergey Karyakin is a Senator of the Russian Federation Council, representing illegally annexed Crimea since 12 September 2024. He was previously a chess Grandmaster, and was suspended due to his statements in support of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. He has continued to support the war, including by publishing an open letter to President Vladimir Putin, travelling to the Ukrainian territories occupied by Russia and gathering military supplies in support of the Russian Armed Forces. For these actions, he has been awarded the Russian Federation medal “For Merit to the Fatherland”.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, he is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Yan Leshchenko is a deputy of the so-called “People’s Council” of the so-called “Luhansk People’s Republic”. Leshchenko is also the regional coordinator of the actions of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine in the occupied territory of Luhansk. He has supported the war in actions and in public statements, including supporting specific attacks by Russia on Ukrainian territory.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, he is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Anna Soroka has been the so-called Commissioner for Human Rights in the so-called “Luhansk People’s Republic” since May 2024. Before this, she worked as an Aide to the so-called “Head of Republic” in the so-called “Luhansk People’s Republic”.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, she is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Anna Lisitsyna is a deputy of the so-called “People’s Council” of the so-called “Luhansk People’s Republic” and a member of its Committee on Construction, Housing and Utilities, Energy, Transport and Communications.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, she is supporting and implementing actions or policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Svetlana Alyoshina is a deputy of the so-called “People’s Council” of the so-called “Luhansk People’s Republic” and a member of its Committee on Construction, Housing and Utilities, Energy, Transport and Communications.; In taking on and acting in this capacity, she is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Anatoly Turchak is the main shareholder and President of JSC “Holding Company ‘Leninetz’”, a Russian entity which controls PJSC “Central Scientific and Production Association ‘Leninetz’” (PJSC CSPA Leninetz).; PJSC CSPA Leninetz is a Russian company specialised in the development and production of radar and navigation equipment, including to the benefit of the Russian military. In particular, PSJC CSPA Leninetz is involved in the production and development of Zaslon airborne radar, which notably equips MiG-31 aircraft used by the Russian military in Ukraine.; Therefore Anatoly Turchak is supporting actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Boris Turchak is the General Director of JSC “Holding Company ‘Leninetz’”, a Russian entity owned by his father, Anatoly Turchak, and which controls PJSC “Central Scientific and Production Association ‘Leninetz’” (PJSC CSPA Leninetz). Boris Turchak is also a shareholder of PJSC CSPA Leninetz.; PJSC CSPA Leninetz is a Russian company specialised in the development and production of radar and navigation equipment, including to the benefit of the Russian military. In particular, PSJC CSPA Leninetz is involved in the production and development of Zaslon airborne radar, which notably equips MiG-31 aircraft used by the Russian military in Ukraine.; Therefore Boris Turchak is supporting actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. He is also associated with Anatoly Turchak.

Igor Kazarezov is the Chairman of the Center for Military Sports Training and patriotic education of youth “WARRIOR”. The WARRIOR Center is a state-led youth organisation established in the Russian Federation to foster patriotic and military education. It is supported by the President of the Russian Federation, who instructed the WARRIOR Center to work in close cooperation with participants in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. The WARRIOR Center is also conducting activities in the illegally occupied territories of Ukraine, through local branches.; The WARRIOR Center has also conducted several projects with the All-Russian public-state movement of children and youth “Movement of the First”, an entity listed by the Union.; Therefore, Igor Kazarezov is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine the territorial integrity of Ukraine. Igor Kazarezov is also associated with the All-Russian public-state movement of children and youth “Movement of the First”.

Kristina Potupchik is a Russian blogger and media entrepreneur. She is the founder of the K2 communications agency which runs social media and information campaigns for clients, predominantly clients controlled by the Russian Government, for which she disseminates misinformation on the war in Ukraine and delegitimises Ukraine’s territorial integrity and sovereignty.; As co-founder of the Association of Internet Technologists she is part of the network of ANO Digital and is closely intertwined with ANO Digital’s misinformation and propaganda policy. In that role, Kristina Potupchik undertook trips to the Russian-occupied regions of Ukraine, especially Mariupol, where she publicly disseminated false information on Russian war crimes and the Ukrainian Government.; Therefore, Kristina Potupchik is supporting actions which undermine the territorial integrity of Ukraine, and supports and benefits from the Government of the Russian Federation.

Sergey Mokeev is the General Director of JSC Novo-Vyatka. JSC Novo-Vyatka, by being a manufacturer of weapons and ammunition, is an entity of the Russian military-industrial complex. In 2023 and 2024, JSC Novo-Vyatka received state subsidies under a programme designed to finance training of military industry workers of selected entities. By being the General Director of JSC Novo-Vyatka, Sergey Mokeev is responsible for the company’s actions. Therefore, Sergey Mokeev supports and benefits from the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Lee Chang Ho coordinated North Korean soldiers deployed on the battlefield in Ukraine, who may have been given tasks related to irregular guerrilla warfare. Thus, he was involved in the participation of North Korean soldiers in the war against Ukraine. He has led cyber-attack units such as Lazarus and Kim Suki.; Therefore, Lee Chang Ho is responsible for supporting and implementing actions which undermine the independence of Ukraine.

Shin Geum Cheol is the Head of the Main Operational Directorate of the General Staff of the Korean People’s Army of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea. He is a high-level military officer overseeing the practical conduct of operations, such as military coordination. He is tasked with disseminating Russian and modern warfare tactics, such as drone operations, artillery tactics and electronic warfare technologies, to the North Korean army.; The North Korean army is involved in military operations in Russia and Ukraine. Therefore, Shin Geum Cheol is responsible for supporting and implementing actions which undermine the independence of Ukraine.

Alexey Gorshkov is the General Director of JSC “Scientific Research Institute of Computing Complexes Named After M.A. Kartsev”, a research institute based in Russia and involved in the development and production of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). It has produced several different types of UAVs, which have been or will be tested by Russian armed forces in the war of aggression against Ukraine. Therefore, as the General Director of JSC “Scientific Research Institute of Computing Complexes Named After M.A. Kartsev”, Alexey Gorshkov is supporting or implementing actions or policies which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Furthermore, he is associated with JSC “Scientific Research Institute of Computing Complexes Named After M.A. Kartsev”.

Natalya Virtuozova is the General Director of the Autonomous Non-Commercial Organization “Directorate of the Exhibition of Achievements ‘Russia’”, which organised the international exhibition and forum “Russia” and now manages the National Center “Russia”. Natalya Virtuozova is also the General Director of the National Center “Russia”. In July 2024, President Putin signed an order to establish the National Center “Russia” to preserve the legacy of the exhibition on a permanent basis. At the “Russia” exhibition, as well as at the National Center “Russia”, there have been exhibitions on the illegally occupied Ukrainian territories, which are presented as territories of the Russian Federation and showcased alongside Russian territories. At the exhibition, events celebrating the Russian occupation and annexation of Ukrainian territories are held regularly. Therefore, as the General Director of the Autonomous Non-Commercial Organization “Directorate of the Exhibition of Achievements ‘Russia’” and the National Center “Russia”, Natalya Virtuozova is supporting and implementing policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Sergey Atlivanchik is the General Director of LLC Eliars, which is a Russian company involved in developing and producing microwave equipment. It has developed and produced the Zont (Umbrella) system, an anti-drone system which allows the suppression of the signal for unmanned aerial vehicles. The Zont system has been used by Russian armed forces in the war of aggression against Ukraine. Therefore, in his role of General Director of LLC Eliars, Sergey Atlivanchik is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Fidail Bikbulatov is the Head of the Regional Headquarters of the All-Russia “Young Army” Military Patriotic Social Movement (Yunarmiya) in the illegally occupied Zaporizhzhia region. He was involved in the mass abduction, illegal deportation and forced transfer of Ukrainian children from occupied territories of Ukraine to Russia.; He took an active part in the militarisation of Ukrainian children in the illegally occupied Zaporizhzhia region. He also spread pro-Russian propaganda and anti-Ukrainian narratives and encouraged children to join Yunarmiya, highlighting the military training as one of the advantages. Furthermore, he was actively involved in the recruitment of volunteers to fight alongside the Russian Armed Forces in the war of aggression against Ukraine.; Therefore, Fidail Bikbulatov is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Furthermore, he is associated with Yunarmiya.

Sergey Dregval is the General Director and Chairman of the Management Board of PJSC Inter RAO, which is one of Russia’s largest energy companies and which is controlled by the Government of the Russian Federation. Shareholders of PJSC Inter RAO include Rosneftgaz, one of the largest dividend payers to the budget of the Russian Federation. PJSC Inter RAO is the main importer/exporter of electricity in Russia. In his capacity as its General Director, Sergey Dregval is tasked with ensuring the source of revenue to the state which allows the financing of aggression against Ukraine.; Sergey Dregval is therefore a leading businessperson operating in Russia and involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.; Furthermore, he is supporting financially and benefitting from the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Vladimir Kolbin is the son of President Vladimir Putin’s childhood friend and business associate, Peter Kolbin. Vladimir Kolbin is acting as representative, director or shareholder of various entities belonging to a network of companies and holding entities securing the financial assets of Vladimir Putin and Gennady Timchenko.; Vladimir Kolbin thus materially and financially benefits from Russian decision-makers responsible for the annexation of Crimea or the destabilisation of Ukraine.; He is associated with Vladimir Putin and Gennady Timchenko.

Konstantin Strukov is a Russian businessperson. He is the President and major shareholder of the Yuzhuralzoloto Group of Companies (which includes UGC, one of the leading gold and mining companies in the Russian Federation).; Konstantin Strukov is therefore involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.

Zhou Dachuang is Chairman of China Head Aerospace Technology LLC.; China Head Aerospace Technology is a PRC-based firm specialised in the production of satellite imagery. The firm is an official supplier of remote sensing data to Russian firm Rakurs, which is a supplier of the Russian Ministry of Defence.; This business cooperation, which came into effect a few weeks after the beginning of the war in Ukraine, included the photogrammetric software program PHOTOMOD which is the main topographic sensing system used by the Military Topographic Directorate of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. Within the context of that program, China Head Aerospace Technology provided topographic data sets and further satellite services, which Rakurs made available to PHOTOMOD customers, including to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation.; By materially supporting the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation through the provision of topographic data and satellite services as Chairman of China Head Aerospace Technology, Zhou Dachuang therefore supports actions which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty or stability of Ukraine, and supports the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Anatoly Kovalev is the General Director of JSC Zelenograd Nanotechnology Center, a Russian research and manufacturing company which is developing and producing high-tech electronical components, including for the development of the Russian military-industrial complex. It is operating in the Special Economic Zone “Technopolis Moscow”. For companies operating in that special economic zone, the Russian Government offers a special tax regime, which encompasses a lower income tax and no property tax, transport tax or customs duties. The company benefits from operating in a privileged environment offered by the Russian Government. As the General Director of JSC Zelenograd Nanotechnology Center, Anatoly Kovalev is therefore benefitting from the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.; JSC Zelenograd Nanotechnology Center has also signed a long-term cooperation agreement to develop Russian domestic electronic engineering with Mikron JSC, which is the largest Russian manufacturer of microelectronics, to produce microchips with the aim of substituting imports from abroad. Mikron JSC holds licences administered by the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation (FSB). As a long-term cooperation agreement has been signed between the two entities for joint activities, JSC Zelenograd Nanotechnology Center is therefore associated with Mikron JSC, which constitutes an entity operating in the Russian IT sector with a licence administered by the FSB Center for Licensing, Certification and Protection of State Secrets. As the General Director of JSC Zelenograd Nanotechnology Center, Anatoly Kovalev is therefore associated with JSC Zelenograd Nanotechnology Center and Mikron JSC.

Igor Khomenko is General Director, co-founder and shareholder of LLC TROS, which manufactures metalworking equipment and is a wholesaler of machine tools. It advertises machining centres with dual-use capabilities and is part of a procurement network to supply metalworking equipment and machine tools into Russia.; The company fulfils Russian Government contracts as well as contracts with entities operating in the Russian defence sector and listed by the Union for supporting the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.; Therefore, in his role as General Director, co-founder and shareholder of LLC TROS, Igor Khomenko is supporting the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine, and is responsible for supporting activities which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Sergey Ushko is CEO, co-founder and shareholder of LLC TROS, which manufactures metalworking equipment and is a wholesaler of machine tools. It advertises machining centres with dual-use capabilities and is part of a procurement network to supply metalworking equipment and machine tools into Russia.; The company fulfils Russian Government contracts as well as contracts with entities operating in the Russian defence sector and listed by the Union for supporting the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.; Therefore, in his role as CEO, co-founder and shareholder of LLC TROS, Sergey Ushko is supporting the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine, and is responsible for supporting activities which undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Julia Baranovskaya is a Russian television presenter and media personality. Since the beginning of the Russian war of aggression against Ukraine, she has frequently supported Russia’s actions that threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. To that end, Julia Baranovskaya hosted Kremlin-sponsored propaganda shows that aimed to stoke up Russian popular support for the invasion, including by publicly promoting Russian war crimes such as the forced deportation of Ukrainian children. Julia Baranovskaya led fundraisers that aimed to secure funds for the Russian war of aggression, where she publicly pledged to commit personal funds as rewards for the fulfilment of Russian military objectives in Ukraine. In addition, Julia Baranovskaya undertook repeated trips to Russian-occupied regions in Ukraine where she provided material support to Russian-sponsored separatist groups.; Julia Baranovskaya therefore supports actions which threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine and conducted transactions with the separatist groups in the Donbas region of Ukraine. She also supports the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Alexey Shadrin is shareholder and co-founder of Promtech JSC. Promtech JSC is a Russian holding company that repeatedly imported goods of European origin while those products were subject to European export restrictions. In particular, Promtech JSC imported those goods through a network of Russian subsidiaries and via the Turkish company Enutek Makina Sanayi Ve Ticaret. Alexey Shadrin therefore facilitated infringements of the prohibition against circumvention of the Union’s restrictive measures regime imposed on the Russian Federation.

Valery Shadrin is General Director of Promtech JSC. Promtech JSC is a Russian holding company that repeatedly imported goods of European origin while those products were subject to European export restrictions. In particular, Promtech JSC imported those goods through a network of Russian subsidiaries and via the Turkish company Enutek Makina Sanayi Ve Ticaret. Valery Shadrin therefore facilitated infringements of the prohibition against circumvention of the Union’s restrictive measures regime imposed on the Russian Federation.

Albert Avdolyan is a Russian businessperson with business interests in the energy sector, especially coal and LNG. Through various companies, notably A-Property-Holdings and Elgaugol, Albert Avodlyan holds significant interests in the Russian energy infrastructure sector, especially coal and LNG. Those economic sectors provide a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.; Therefore, Albert Avdolyan is a Russian businessperson involved in economic sectors providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation. Through his business interests, he is also closely associated with the Rostec State Corporation.

Mikhail Galustyan is a Russian propagandist, president of the Federation of Military and Tactical Games and a member of the management of the All-Russian children’s and youth military-patriotic movement “Yunarmiya”, a Russian paramilitary organisation subject to Union restrictive measures. He is a long-term supporter of President Vladimir Putin and his policies, and has been using his popularity to spread the messages and narratives of Kremlin propaganda.; Mikhail Galustyan is a management member of Yunarmiya, which operates regional branches located in the temporarily illegally occupied territories of Ukraine. It also organises fundraisers and activities in support of combatants participating in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine. Yunarmiya and its members support Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine and spread Russian propaganda concerning the war. Yunarmiya uses the “Z” military symbol, which has been employed by Russian propaganda to promote Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; Moreover, Mikhail Galustyan is directly responsible for the activities of an organisation that promotes the militarisation of Russian youth. He supports the creation of a training ground to be used for military tactical games and for the training of volunteers for a “special military operation” carried out by combatants who took part in the war against Ukraine.; He is therefore supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Ruslan Ostashko is a figure active in the Russian public space. He works as a journalist and TV host on state TV Channel One and is the lead singer of the patriotic music band “Ours”. He is also editor-in-chief of the website “politrussia.com”, a website used to promote the Russian Government’s narrative, including on Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; Ruslan Ostashko is also a member of the Putin-initiated organisation People’s Front Central Headquarters (formerly All-Russia People’s Front), an entity listed under Union restrictive measures.; Through his activities and communication platforms, projects and music concerts, Ruslan Ostashko actively promotes and praises the Russian army fighting in Ukraine. He organises support events and fundraisers and engages with Russian fighters through various projects.; Therefore, Ruslan Ostashko is responsible for actively supporting actions which undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Denis Chernobay is the Chairman of the so-called “Donetsk People Republic” branch of the All-Russian public-state movement of children and youth “Movement of the First”, an entity listed by the Union.; In his position, Denis Chernobay has been actively engaged in organising educational activities aimed at the militarisation of education and promoting Russian Federation propaganda in the illegally occupied region of Ukraine of Donetsk. In his position, he has also provided support to the Russian military in the illegally occupied territories of Ukraine.; Therefore, Denis Chernobay is supporting actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine, and stability and security in Ukraine.

Vladislav Lobaev is the Chief Designer of the LLC Design Bureau of Integration Systems (LLC KBIS). He is also one of the founders of the Lobaev group of companies (including LLC Trading House Lobaev Arms) and President of the Foundation “Lobaev Foundation”. “Lobaev Foundation” is a unit of the Lobaev Group of entities and collects funds to finance the projects of Lobaev Arms. Lobaev Arms rifles are used by the Russian Armed Forces in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; By being founder of the Lobaev group of companies and President of the Foundation “Lobaev Foundation”, Vladislav Lobaev is responsible for the companies’ actions and therefore he supports and benefits financially from the Government of the Russian Federation, which is responsible for the annexation of Crimea and the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Vladimir Yevtushenkov has been a shareholder in Sistema since the company was founded in 1993. Sistema is a conglomerate with business interests in various sectors of the Russian economy in which it is represented by the ownership or control of companies including Agroholding Steppe (agriculture), BESK (energy), Binnofarm (pharmaceutics), Cosmos Hotel Group (tourism), Element (electronics), Intourist (tourism), Medsi (healthcare), Ozon (e-commerce), Region AO (military industry) and Segezha (forest, woodworking, pulp and paper industry). Sistema is also involved in the information, communications and digital technologies sectors, including through its share in the Mobile TeleSystems (MTS) Public Joint Stock Company, as well as in banking, as MTS-Bank is owned by the MTS Public Joint Stock Company via Mobile TeleSystems B.V. Through BESK and its subsidiaries Bashkirenergo, BSK and BESK Engineering, Sistema is involved in the energy sector which provides substantial revenues to the Government of the Russian Federation. Vladimir Yevtushenkov was a majority owner in Sistema until April 2022 when he transferred part of his share to his son, Felix Vladimirovich Yevtushenkov. Therefore, Vladimir Yevtushenkov is a businessperson involved in an economic sector providing a substantial source of revenue to the Government of the Russian Federation.; Vladimir Yevtushenkov has a long-standing relationship with President Vladimir Putin and was present at the meeting of businessmen in the Kremlin with President Putin on the day of the launch of the invasion of Ukraine on 24 February 2022. Vladimir Yevtushenkov owns a 49,2  % share in Sistema, chairs the Committee on Industrial Policy of the Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs (RSPP), is a Bureau member of the RSPP Board, co-chairs the Russian-Saudi Business Council and is a member of the Russian-Saudi Economic Council as well as of the National Council on Corporate Governance. Therefore, Vladimir Yevtushenkov is a leading businessperson operating in Russia.

Boris Bogatyrev is the General Director of LLC Stan. LLC Stan is a Russian company active in the field of design and production of machine-tool equipment. LLC Stan supplies control drilling and milling machines for high-tech industries, and operates under the management of RT-Capital of the Rostec State Corporation. Its machines (including the VMB 55 model) are provided to companies in the aircraft, engine-building and defence industries. Therefore, LLC Stan supports and benefits from the Government of the Russian Federation. By being the General Director of LLC Stan, Boris Bogatyrev is responsible for the company’s actions and is associated with the company.; In addition, Boris Bogatyrev is the Chairman of the Moscow Regional Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs, a regional association of employers.

Nikita Nagorny is Deputy Chairman of the Board of the All-Russian public-state movement of children and youth “Movement of the First” and the former chief of the general staff of the All-Russia “Young Army” Military Patriotic Social Movement (Yunarmiya). He was involved in the mass abduction, illegal deportation and forced transfer of Ukrainian children from occupied territories of Ukraine to Russia.; In March 2022, Nikita Nagorny offered to forward gifts to Russian troops fighting in Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.; Nikita Nagorny is a prominent athlete with a large audience and significant influence on his fans. He publicly supported the actions of the Russian Federation in Ukraine. Through his influence, he is responsible for spreading pro-Russian propaganda and disinformation regarding Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, as well as playing an active role in rallying domestic support in Russia for the war against Ukraine.; Therefore, Nikita Nagorny is supporting and implementing actions and policies which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

Aleksandr Sychugov is the General Director of JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” and was previously the General Director of Federal State Enterprise “Voskresensk State Aggregate Plant” from 24 September 2018 until the reorganisation of the company on 31 January 2023. Therefore, Sychugov has been the General Director and thus the main decision-maker of “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” since 24 September 2018.; JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” (previously Federal State Enterprise “Voskresensk State Aggregate Plant”) assembles anti-aircraft guided missiles, air-to-air and air-to-surface guided missiles, cruise missiles, high-explosive aerial bombs (FABs) and improved FABs with unified gliding and correction modules which transform free-falling Russian bombs into guided ones. The net asset value of JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” as of 31 December 2023 was RUB 2 027 159 762,00.; The shareholder of JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” is JSC Concern VKO Almaz-Antey (listed entity under Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 of 31 July 2014 concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine and Council Regulation (EU) No 269/2014 of 17 March 2014 concerning restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine), a Russian state-owned arms manufacturer that develops anti-aircraft defence and cruise missile systems for the Russian military. Thus, JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” is one of the most important air defence missile system manufacturers in the Russian Federation. Russia uses weapons from JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory” in Ukraine, including in attacks on civilian targets. As the General Director, Sychugov has been the main decision-maker since September 2018. Therefore, he is responsible for the use in Ukraine of weapons manufactured by JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory”.; Therefore, Aleksandr Sychugov, as the General Director of JSC “Voskresensky Aggregation Factory”, is responsible for actions which undermine and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. Since the company is a supplier of military equipment to the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, Aleksandr Sychugov is also benefitting from Russian decision-makers responsible for the destabilisation of Ukraine.

Vadim Badekha is the General Director of United Aircraft Corporation (UAC).
